org.madsenlab.sim.tf.interfaces
Interface IPopulation

All Superinterfaces:
IDeme
All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleAgentPopulation
public interface IPopulation
extends IDeme

IPopulation is the full collection of agents in a simulation model. Classes implementing IPopulation are the locus of agent creation, tracking, and destruction in a model.

Subpopulations in TransmissionFramework are called "demes," and are not represented by persistent objects but rather are "projections" of the population (by tag, by geography, by trait group, etc). Most operations one would routinely perform on a group of agents (e.g., selecting a random agent, selecting a subset of agents which have a particular trait or tag) are done through the IDeme abstraction. IPopulation extends IDeme and adds agent creation and destruction.

User: mark Date: Aug 21, 2010 Time: 3:06:05 PM

Method Detail

createAgent

IAgent createAgent()
Creates a newly initialized agent, using the underlying agentProvider (thus automatically creating whatever agent implementation is being used in this simulation model). The new agent object is added to the population list, the population size is incremented, and any population structure (e.g., network, lattice) object is notified and passed the object for insertion into the population structure. Following this, the new agent is returned to the caller.

Returns:
agent

removeAgent

void removeAgent(IAgent agent)
Removes a specified agent from the population (allowing simulation of death or outmigration, for example). Any population structure object registered with this population is notified, so that the agent can be removed (e.g., vertex and links in a network removed), the population size is decremented, and the agent object is removed from the population list.

Simulation code should not hold persistent references to individual agent objects for a duration longer than a simulation step, because those references might end up invalid, or pointing to and agent object which no longer belongs to a population and thus is not "part" of the model anymore.

Parameters:
agent -

clearAgentPopulation

void clearAgentPopulation()
